tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: A cat's whiskers are thought to be a kind of radar, which helps a cat gauge the space it intends to walk through.

tasks.title: Comida para el gato
tasks.description: Comprar comida para el michi

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Sir Isaac Newton is credited with creating the concept for the pet door that many cats use today to travel outdoors.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Cats step with both left legs, then both right legs when they walk or run.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Cats must have fat in their diet because they can't produce it on their own.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Blue-eyed, pure white cats are frequently deaf.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: The group of words associated with cat (catt, cath, chat, katze) stem from the Latin catus, meaning domestic cat, as opposed to feles, or wild cat.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: In relation to their body size, cats have the largest eyes of any mammal.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: A cat can’t climb head first down a tree because every claw on a cat’s paw points the same way. To get down from a tree, a cat must back down.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: The Ancient Egyptian word for cat was mau, which means "to see".

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Cat paws act as tempetature regulators, shock absorbers, hunting and grooming tools, sensors, and more

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: A cat usually has about 12 whiskers on each side of its face.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: It has been scientifically proven that stroking a cat can lower one's blood pressure.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Cats are extremely sensitive to vibrations. Cats are said to detect earthquake tremors 10 or 15 minutes before humans can.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: The most traveled cat is Hamlet, who escaped from his carrier while on a flight. He hid for seven weeks behind a panel on the airplane. By the time he was discovered, he had traveled nearly 373,000 miles (600,000 km).

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Every year, nearly four million cats are eaten in Asia.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: A cat can jump 5 times as high as it is tall.

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Cats have "nine lives" thanks to a flexible spine and powerful leg and back muscles

tasks.title: Random Cat Fact
tasks.description: Statistics indicate that animal lovers in recent years have shown a preference for cats over dogs!

tasks.title: Hola
tasks.description: holita
